channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Defibrillator calls after Barry cricketer dies
item.description: Father-of-three Maqsood Anwar, 44, was playing cricket when he collapsed.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Self-isolation rethink over child contacts
item.description: Ministers consider whether children should not have to isolate if a close contact tests positive.

item.title: Tenby: Toddler found safe after coastguard search
item.description: Two swimmers who got into difficulty were also rescued by lifeboat crews on Sunday.

item.title: Rescuers find lost dog Ollie after swim off Porthcawl
item.description: Ollie was found by the RNLI three miles away from where he jumped into the sea for a swim.

item.title: Covid rules being lifted sparks waterfall traffic fears
item.description: Residents say they do not want a repeat of last year's parking problems and traffic jams.

item.title: Covid: Plaid urge caution over easing rules in August
item.description: Wales should not get rid of most rules in early August if cases are rising, according to Plaid Cymru.

item.title: Man's 'unexplained' death in Llantwit Major prompts police probe
item.description: Police erect a cordon after officers are called to a property after a 50-year-old man's body was found.

item.title: Cardiff police charge man, 19, after Bute Park sex attack
item.description: He has been remanded in custody and is due to appear before Cardiff magistrates on Monday.

item.title: Respect all members, says independence group leader
item.description: The YesCymru pro-independence group needs structural changes, its new interim chair says.

item.title: Pontypool: The town looking for a fresh start
item.description: The once prosperous town of Pontypool is trying to reinvent itself in the wake of the pandemic.

item.title: Covid: Sunshine in Wales puts indoor meet-ups on hold
item.description: Groups of six are now allowed to meet in homes - but not many want to be indoors.

item.title: Cardiff's Jewish history brought to life by virtual trail
item.description: The history of the city's Jewish community has been brought to life by a virtual trail.

item.title: Covid: Pontypool shoppers want to 'revive' town centre
item.description: Once a major city centre, Pontypool town like many other places has seen shops close due to Covid.

item.title: Amputee's win for prosthetics funding in Wales shows 'people power'
item.description: David Bradley said amputees in Wales had been disadvantaged compared to the rest of the UK.

item.title: Covid: Why rinks opening in Wales is on ice
item.description: Although ice rinks can re-open from Saturday, Ice Arena Wales will be ready from 1 August.

item.title: Offa's Dyke: 'I needed to get off my backside and do something'
item.description: Jon Moss decided to sell his home and set off on a 177 mile trek across Wales.

item.title: Welsh woman reunited with family after Kuwait prison release
item.description: Sara Assayed returns home after being cleared of drug charges in Kuwait.

item.title: Wedding recreated at care home: 'This is the day I've been waiting for'
item.description: A new bride surprises her grandmother by recreating her wedding in her care home.

item.title: Wayne Pivac: Wales head coach takes stock after longest season
item.description: Wales finish their season with a defeat against Argentina and now look ahead to New Zealand as opening opponents of the next campaign.

item.title: Stormers 3-49 British and Irish Lions: Tourists complete Test preparations with comfortable win
item.description: The British and Irish Lions complete their Test series preparations with a comfortable win against the Stormers.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Wing Josh Adams 'emotional' after birth of baby
item.description: Wales wing Josh Adams says he had to keep his emotions in check after returning to the field for the British and Irish Lions after the birth of his daughter.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: First Covid cases in athletes' village and Team GB have eight self-isolating
item.description: Two South Africa footballers test positive for Covid-19 in Olympic village, while eight Team GB athletes and staff isolating as close contacts.

item.title: T20 Blast: Hampshire hammer Glamorgan to keep hopes alive
item.description: Hampshire smash their way to a remarkable six-wicket win over Glamorgan to keep alive their quarter-final hopes.

item.title: Plaid yn galw am beidio llacio os ydy achosion ar gynnydd
item.description: Plaid Cymru'n dweud bod angen i'r llywodraeth fod yn barod i "gymryd cam yn ôl" os nad ydy achosion yn gostwng.

item.title: YesCymru yn galw am 'barchu pawb' wedi ffraeo chwyrn
item.description: "Rydyn ni'n gwybod bod angen newidiadau" yn ôl y cadeirydd dros dro, yn dilyn cecru ymysg aelodau.

item.title: Covid-19: Cofnodi tair marwolaeth arall yng Nghymru
item.description: Cafodd 1,112 yn rhagor o achosion eu cofnodi hefyd, ac mae'r raddfa heintio bellach yn 161.1.

item.title: Jade Jones: 'Unrhyw beth heblaw aur yn fethiant'
item.description: Y Pencampwr Olympaidd o'r Fflint sy'n rhoi cipolwg ar ei bywyd o gasglu sgrap i ennill yr aur

item.title: Hampshire yn trechu Morgannwg yn y T20 yn Southampton
item.description: Tymor T20 Morgannwg i ben gyda cholled arall, y tro hwn yn erbyn Hampshire yn Southampton.
